page.title: 20RETTENDON SCHOOL
page.content: The School was built in 1878. The role numbered 85, similar to the present role. The School now has its own hall built in 1976, previously the pupils crossed a busy road to use the village hall for lunch and P.E. The School is central to village life. The School- Master until recently, lived in the school-house and played an active part in the village. The annual jumble-sale and summer fete are great village events. The O.A.P.s are the recipients of the annual Harvest Festival gifts, the children delivering bags to every pensioner in the parish. The School is used in the evening for Brownies, Guides and Keep-Fit. The School swimming pool was bought by the parents, 'The Friends of Rettendon School', raising large amounts of money from social events to buy extras like computers.
